data.prayer: Father, please send new apostles into the harvest, who can open up new communities for the gospel in the state of Kabale, Uganda.
data.verse: Ask the Lord of the harvest, therefore, to send out workers into his harvest field.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Kabale, Uganda
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, make the Word of God a delight to the people of Kabale, like it was to David.
data.verse: I delight in your decrees; I will not neglect your Word.

data.prayer: Father, give the disciples of the the state of Kabale an urgency of seeing every people and place reached for the gospel.
data.verse: As long as it is day, we must do the works of him who sent me. Night is coming, when no one can work.

data.prayer: Father, help the 14,420 believers in Kabale to be spiritually intentional with their relationships among their 29,081 lost friends and neighbors.
Lord we ask you on behalf of the Nubian people. 0.0% are known to be believers. Oh God, please share with them the great gift of your son Jesus and your kingdom.
Jesus, please bless the leaders of the the state of Kabale, Uganda who work hard at shepherding and guiding your people.
data.verse: With upright heart he shepherded them and guided them with his skillful hand.

data.prayer: Lord, the believers in the state of Kabale, Uganda need teachers who can feed them with knowledge and understanding. Please raise them up.
data.verse: Then I will give you shepherds after My own heart, who will feed you with knowledge and understanding.

data.prayer: Father, please raise up prophets in Kabale who can call the church to holiness and purity, preparing your church as a bride for your Son.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

location.name: Kabale
location.people_groups_list: Karamojong, Kalenjin, Pokot, Mvuba, Nyang'i, Hindi
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Karamojong (849,000), Kalenjin, Pokot (134,000), Mvuba (1,200), Nyang'i (18,000), Hindi (5,800)
